```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r read-data, include=FALSE}
covid19 <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/datasets/covid-19/master/data/time-series-19-covid-combined.csv")
```

Here is a plot of COVID-19 cases in Indonesia.

```{r filter-data, include=FALSE}
inddata <- covid19 %>%
  filter(`Country/Region` == "Indonesia") 
```

```{r creating-plot, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
inddata %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = as.Date(Date),
             y = as.numeric(Confirmed))) +
  geom_point()
```
The number of confirmed cases in Indonesia is going up in an increasing rate!
